definitions.definition: Of a tissue, structure, or part of an organ: to protrude through the muscular tissue or the membrane by which it is normally contained, causing a hernia .
examples: When the small intestine herniates into the groin, one has an inguinal hernia.

main_definition: ( intransitive ) Of a tissue, structure, or part of an organ: to protrude through the muscular tissue or the membrane by which it is normally contained, causing a hernia .
